meanings.definition: A rare earth element used in glassmaking.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the properties of didymiums in glass production.
meanings.sent2: The artisan added didymiums to the glass mixture for a special color.
meanings.sent3: The glassblower accidentally spilled didymiums all over the workshop, creating a colorful mess.
meanings.sent4: The presence of didymiums in the glass gave it a magical, iridescent quality.
meanings.sent5: The rare didymiums glowed brightly under the light, captivating everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A mixture of neodymium and praseodymium.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler crafted a beautiful necklace using didymiums as the main material.
meanings.sent2: The factory imported barrels of didymiums for their production line.
meanings.sent3: The children at the science fair marveled at the shiny didymiums on display.
meanings.sent4: The artist's palette contained vibrant colors reminiscent of didymiums.
meanings.sent5: The market was bustling with vendors selling various products made with didymiums.

meanings.definition: A type of glass containing didymium oxide.
meanings.sent1: The antique shop displayed a collection of delicate didymiums glassware.
meanings.sent2: The laboratory tested the durability of didymiums glass under extreme conditions.
meanings.sent3: The magician performed a trick using a crystal ball made of didymiums.
meanings.sent4: The sunset reflected beautifully through the didymiums glass windows.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit showcased intricate sculptures made from didymiums glass.
